title: Europe seize initiative to take 11½-4½ lead over USA into Ryder Cup singles
summary: Europe takes a commanding lead in the Ryder Cup, with a score of 11½-4½ after dominating the USA in Saturday’s foursomes and fourballs. They need just 2½ points to secure victory and retain the trophy. The competition reflects Europe's strong performance throughout the event.

title: Ryder Cup: USA 4½-11½ Europe – visitors dominate fourballs to stretch lead on fiery day two – live
summary: Live updates from day two at Bethpage Black highlight Europe's efforts to strengthen their lead. Coverage includes hole-by-hole reports and the latest developments in the competition. Join our writers for real-time insights as the event unfolds.

title: K-cure: South Korea’s booming market for traditional (and novel) hangover remedies
summary: Hovenia dulcis, or heotgae in Korean, has emerged as a key ingredient in South Korea's rapidly growing hangover remedy market. The fruit's medicinal properties are being increasingly recognized and utilized in various products. This trend reflects a broader cultural focus on wellness and recovery methods in the country.

title: Scottie Scheffler’s flop shows Ryder Cup can bring down even world No 1s | Bryan Armen Graham
summary: Scottie Scheffler, the world No. 1, made history at the Ryder Cup by losing all three of his opening matches, marking the worst start for a top-ranked player in the event's history. This unprecedented outcome highlights the pressure and unpredictability of the tournament. Scheffler's performance has drawn significant attention and criticism.
